revised_title: Tree Models of Aggregation: Multiple Particle and Bond Types
tldr: This article explores tree models of aggregation where particles bond pairwise to form tree-structures, which can represent various applications such as chemical polymerization, the precipitin reaction, and cell-surface aggregates in immunology. The author uses branching processes to determine the polymer distribution and provides criteria for the existence of an infinite aggregate (a gel) and the distribution of finite aggregates (the sol). The study also discusses the challenges of incorporating ring-formation into graph-theoretic models.
